title: The least common multiple
text: The LCM or least common multiple of a set of numbers is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by all those numbers.
speech: The LCM or least common multiple of a set of numbers is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by all those numbers.
pacedSpeech: The LCM or least common multiple of a set of numbers is the smallest positive integer that is divisible by all those numbers.

title: The least common multiple
text: To combine the fractions in the numerator, we want to find the LCM of the denominators. What is it?
speech: To combine the fractions in the numerator, we want to find the LCM of the denominators. What is it?
pacedSpeech: To combine the fractions in the numerator, we want to find the LCM of the denominators. What is it?

title: Multiplication by $$1$$
text: We must multiple each expression by the appropriate form of $$1$$ to obtain xy as the denominator for each fraction.
speech: We must multiple each expression by the appropriate form of  1  to obtain xy as the denominator for each fraction.
pacedSpeech: We must multiple each expression by the appropriate form of   1
to obtain xy as the denominator for each fraction.

title: Multiplication by $$1$$
text: What should we multiply to $$\frac{x}{y}$$ so that its denominator becomes xy?
speech: What should we multiply to  x over y,  so that its denominator becomes xy?
pacedSpeech: What should we multiply to   x over y,
so that its denominator becomes xy?

title: Multiplication by $$1$$
text: What should we multiply to $$\frac{y}{x}$$ so that its denominator becomes xy?
speech: What should we multiply to  y over x  so that its denominator becomes xy?
pacedSpeech: What should we multiply to   y over x
so that its denominator becomes xy?

title: Adding Terms
text: Now that both terms have the same denominator, we can add their numerators. What does the numerator simplify to?
speech: Now that both terms have the same denominator, we can add their numerators. What does the numerator simplify to?
pacedSpeech: Now that both terms have the same denominator, we can add their numerators. What does the numerator simplify to?

title: Cancel terms
text: Now that you have factored all possible terms, if you see the same term in the numerator and the denominator of the product, you can cancel it out.
speech: Now that you have factored all possible terms, if you see the same term in the numerator and the denominator of the product, you can cancel it out.
pacedSpeech: Now that you have factored all possible terms, if you see the same term in the numerator and the denominator of the product, you can cancel it out.

title: Cancel terms
text: What term can we cancel out?
speech: What term can we cancel out?
pacedSpeech: What term can we cancel out?

title: Final Answer
text: After canceling out terms, your final answer will remain in product form. What is the answer?
speech: After canceling out terms, your final answer will remain in product form. What is the answer?
